newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Metro says no idea why share price rose.
newsitem.headline: Metro says no idea why share price rose.

text.p: Retailer Metro Holdings Ltd said on Friday it had no idea why its share price had risen in active trade earlier in the day.

"The directors are not aware of any material information or circumstances which could have led to the increase in the price and trading volume of the company's shares on the stock exchange today," Metro said in a statement.
The company's share price earlier rose Singapore $1.70 to touch its previous year high of S$6.20 in intraday trade before sliding back to close at S$6.05, up S$1.55 or 34.4 percent.
Metro was Singapore's most active share on Friday with 16.69 million shares changing hands.

Dealers said earlier on Friday it was rumoured that the company might be a takeover target. One possible suitor mentioned was property group First Capital Corp, which already owns a 5.6 percent stake in Metro Holdings.
The rumour suggested the takeover price would be S$7.00 -- well below its estimated net asset value of S$8.00 per share.
Metro Holdings last traded at S$6.20 on September 25, 1995.
First Capital officials were not immediately available for comment. -- Singapore newsroom (65 8703080)
